sentences.sContent: Could you get an extra loaf of bread?
Allow extra time for your journey.
sentences.sCn: 要给你的旅程多留出点时间。

sentences.sContent: Drivers are advised to take extra care.
sentences.sCn: 建议司机开车要格外小心。

sentences.sContent: You’re going to have to work extra hard to pass the exam.
sentences.sCn: 你要格外用功才能通过考试。

sentences.sContent: ...These extra features are deemed unnecessary by the majority of shoppers...
...the extra time and money spent pursuing a college diploma will leave them worse off than they were before they set foot on campus...
...And she makes a little extra money by sending stories to newspapers in the States...
...I’ve been working extra hours all week...
...and gained several extra years of life because of treatment...
...They are also well placed to bring something extra to the teaching side of an academic role that will help students get a job when they graduate...
...extra feeding can keep a bird warm and well...

exam.question: In order to show his boss what a careful worker he was, he took _______ trouble over the figures.

answer.explain: take extra trouble over： 在…方面下额外的工夫。句意： 为了向老板显示自己工作十分仔细， 他在数字上下了额外的工夫。extensive： 广阔的； 大量的； spare： 备用的， 少量的； supreme： (阶级、 地位、 权力)至高的； 最重要的。

synos.tran: 临时演员；号外；额外的事物；上等产品
额外的，[经]另外收费的；特大的

phrases.pCn: 额外的钱；[英国俚语]超速罚款单
额外费用；额外成本；追加费用
特强的；超重的；加厚的；超功率的
[化]超细的；超级的；极优的；高级优质的
额外报酬；奖励；额外的费用
加强的；高强度的；特别强壮的

remMethod.val: 本身为词根， 意为： 额外的， 特别的

trans.tranOther: more of something, in addition to the usual or standard amount or number
used to emphasize an adjective or adverb
